occurrences.text: We're ready this evening to turn to a number of passages, and this is going to be a springboard passage that we're going to start in here and look at a number of verses of Scripture this evening. As we really are going to enter into, this will be kind of an introductory lesson or message on a series that we'll do on Wednesday evenings here for the next, I don't know, six to ten weeks, something like that, and as the Lord would lead. But the title for the message this evening, and really the title for the whole series will be this, The Danger of Deception. The Danger of Deception. I believe this evening, well let's look at Mark 13, look at verses 5 and 6. The Bible says here in Mark 13, And Jesus, answering them, began to say, Take heed, lest any man deceive you. For many shall come in my name, saying, I am Christ, and shall deceive many. What a warning that is issued here in Mark chapter number 13. You can read it in Matthew 24 as well, but you find that the Lord Jesus Christ in verse number 5 says, Take heed, lest any man deceive you. The word deceive means to cause, to stray. It carries with it the idea of to lead astray or to lead aside from the right way. It's also understood that this word deceive carries with it the idea of to lead away from
